intro: Couepia formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan couepia, is a flowering plant native to southern China and Taiwan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
